name: Sunflower
description:
Journal entry - shoot day 5

“I was in a haze, 4 hours sleep over 50 hours was catching up to me. I sped down the highway without a license.  Sergio and Viktor rolling in the back, black coffee and cigarettes. Viktor passed around a joint, we were too deep not to commit. Royal headache burst through the speakers in a last waking effort. What happened next was a mind-bending dance between worlds. Deliriousness, strange lingering anxiety mixed in with the depression of a looming Vancouver. Reality? Lulu and I played. She danced on the fence, unsure of who she was. It was a dangerous line to cross. How long have we been doing this? The scene was beautiful. Honestly. No lines recalled. Just organic beats driving us forward, talking us home”.

100% of the money raised will go to finishing this truly independent film and paying the artists. Four years of blood, sweat and tears. A cult classic in the making.

AUS/NZ Distribution: Pivot Pictures, Filmink Presents

PR + Trailer: https://www.grass-fires.com/blog/milesawaytrailer

10/10

Photographer: Gerard Wood
